biography.value:
The dragon Beledros masters the intertwined magic of life and death. Her power taps into the life force flowing through living things and the natural world. She manipulates that energy to give healing and life or to bring death and decay. Her mastery of this magic sustains her own life force even without the sustenance of food, drink, or even air.

She founded Witherbloom College to pass on her understanding of the natural cycle. She hoped to create generations of stewards who would use her teachings to defend nature and help others. In keeping with the dichotomous nature of her philosophy and magic, she views the more dangerous aspects of nature, including the inevitability of death and decay, as natural and integral parts of existence.

description.value:
Beledros makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 1d12 type=necrotic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Beledros exhales decaying energy in a 90-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save con 23 format=long]], taking [[/damage 6d12 type=necrotic average=true]] damage and [[/damage 6d12 type=poison average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that takes damage from the breath can’t regain hit points until the start of Beledros’s next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Beledros becomes a swirling cloud of green mist and can move up to half her flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks, then resumes her true form. During this movement, she can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If she moves through a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save con 23 format=long]] or become &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} until the end of its next turn. If Beledros ends this move inside an object, she takes [[/damage 1d10 type=force average=true]] damage and is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Beledros casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} as the spellcasting ability:

1/day each: greater restoration, mass cure wounds, &Reference[plant]{plant} growth, revivify, speak with dead

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Beledros can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Beledros regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

Claw. Beledros makes one Claw attack.

Miasmal Flow (Costs 2 Actions). Beledros uses Miasmal Flow.

Teeming with Life (Costs 3 Actions). Beledros magically summons 1d4 pest mascot;pest mascots in unoccupied spaces she can see within 60 feet of herself. The pests obey her commands and take their turns immediately after hers. Any creature, other than a pest, takes [[/damage 2d8 type=poison average=true]] damage if it starts its turn within 5 feet of one or more of these pests. When one of these pests drops to 0 hit points, Beledros regains [[/damage 9 type=heal average=false]] hit points. These pests disappear after 10 minutes, when Beledros dies, or when she uses this action again.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Beledros uses Miasmal Flow.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Beledros magically summons 1d4 pest mascot;pest mascots in unoccupied spaces she can see within 60 feet of herself. The pests obey her commands and take their turns immediately after hers. Any creature, other than a pest, takes [[/damage 2d8 type=poison average=true]] damage if it starts its turn within 5 feet of one or more of these pests. When one of these pests drops to 0 hit points, Beledros regains [[/damage 9 type=heal average=false]] hit points. These pests disappear after 10 minutes, when Beledros dies, or when she uses this action again.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If Beledros fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Unusual &Reference[nat]{Nature}. Beledros doesn’t require air, food, or drink.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's &Reference[exhaustion]{exhaustion} level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

  • One effect that &Reference[charmed]{charmed} or &Reference[petrified]{petrified} the target
  • One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item
  • Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores
  • One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

A wave of healing energy washes out from a point of your choice within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on that point. Each target regains hit points equal to 3d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on &Reference[undead]{undead} or constructs.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

This spell channels vitality into plants within a specific area. There are two possible uses for the spell, granting either immediate or long-term benefits.

If you cast this spell using 1 action, choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 100-foot radius centered on that point become thick and overgrown. A creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.

You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.

If you cast this spell over 8 hours, you enrich the land. All plants in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range become enriched for 1 year. The plants yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested.

You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. That creature returns to life with 1 hit point. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts.

system.chatFlavor: [healing] Target creature that has died within the last minute

description.value:
You grant the semblance of life and &Reference[int]{intelligence} to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer the questions you pose. The corpse must still have a mouth and can't be &Reference[undead]{undead}. The spell fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the last 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are hostile to it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.
